summary.para: The Clone method makes a copy of the enumerator with the same enumeration state.

param.name: ppEnum
param.para: Receives a pointer to the interface of the new enumerator. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT

description.para: The filter's state has changed and is now inconsistent with the enumerator.

remarks.para: If the number of pins changes, the enumerator is no longer consistent with the filter, and the method returns VFW_E_ENUM_OUT_OF_SYNC. Discard any data obtained from previous calls to the enumerator, because it might be invalid. Update the enumerator by calling the method. You can then call the Clone method safely.

summary.para: The Next method retrieves a specified number of pins in the enumeration sequence.

param.name: ppPins
param.para: Array of size cPins that is filled with pointers. The caller must release the interfaces.

param.name: pcFetched
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the number of pins retrieved. Can be NULL if cPins is 1.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

description.para: Did not retrieve as many pins as requested.
The filter's state has changed and is now inconsistent with the enumerator.

remarks.para: This method retrieves pointers to the specified number of pins, starting at the current position in the enumeration, and places them in the specified array.
If the method succeeds, the IPin pointers all have outstanding reference counts. Be sure to release them when you are done.

If the number of pins changes, the enumerator is no longer consistent with the filter, and the method returns VFW_E_ENUM_OUT_OF_SYNC. Discard any data obtained from previous calls to the enumerator, because it might be invalid. Update the enumerator by calling the method. You can then call the Next method safely.

summary.para: The Reset method resets the enumeration sequence to the beginning.
The Skip method skips over a specified number of pins.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT

description.para: Skipped past the end of the sequence.
The filter's state has changed and is now inconsistent with the enumerator.

remarks.para: If the number of pins changes, the enumerator is no longer consistent with the filter, and the method returns VFW_E_ENUM_OUT_OF_SYNC. Discard any data obtained from previous calls to the enumerator, because it might be invalid. Update the enumerator by calling the method. You can then call the Skip method safely.

summary.para: The method returns this interface. It is based on the standard Component Object Model (COM) enumerators.
The filter graph manager uses this interface when it connects filters. Applications can use it to retrieve pins on a filter. For more information, see Enumerating Objects in a Filter Graph.
If the number of pins on the filter changes, some methods on this interface return VFW_E_ENUM_OUT_OF_SYNC. Call the method to resynchronize the enumerator.
